The parish has beautiful natural landscapes and the people there work raising animals, in agriculture, and in arts and crafts.  Many work in the city of Cuenca carrying out various jobs.  The people there are friendly and they preserve the culture and traditions of their people.

Silvia, 28, is married and from her marriage has two children, ages 10 and 8, who are in school.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession.  They do not have their own house so they rent.

Silvia has worked for nine years selling "chumales" [a type of tamal] and "quimbolitos" [a corn-based steamed dessert], traditional dishes.  She sells them all over the city from Monday through Saturday, relying on a select clientele.  At home she works raising animals such as pigs and chickens. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for seven years.  She is going to invest her new loan in buying chickens and animal feed.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Fet For Shameness Group

texts.en:
Ishiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ishiatu was born in Mattru, in southern Sierra Leone. She is twenty-five years old. Ishiatu is married to a driver and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. Ishiatu sells a wide variety of items including toothpaste, toothbrushes, soaps, etc. She has been selling these items for five years now.

With the help of this loan, Ishaitu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Ishiatu will use her share of the loan (800,000.00 SLL) to buy more toothpaste, toothbrushes, and soap in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, and soap in large quantities to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Na For Pay Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Na For Pay” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Adama is the leader of this group. The thirty-eight-year-old is married to a miner and the couple has three children. Adama has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years now.  Adama sells market food like palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Abenwa

texts.en: Abenwa sell oranges and maize at Dompoase near Elmina, which she has done for five years now. She is married to a farmer and has five children.  She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe her children. Abenwa will use her loan to purchase oranges and bags of maize to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase oranges and bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa lives together with her husband, who is a fisherman, and 2 children at Dompoase near Elmina. Adjoa sells secondhand clothes and kenkey. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. Adjoa will use her loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Nerida Susana

texts.es: Nerida es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros, tiene 62 años, se dedica a la venta y compra de abarrotes y comida en las ferias, ahora esta empezando con la compra y venta de cochinilla, es madre de 4 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, ella siente que ha progresado mucho en su vida familiar y personal, agradece a Finca por toda la ayuda que le dan, ella recuerda y valora que antes solo estaba en la chacra y no veía todo lo que podía realizar, al ser parte de Finca Perú ella abrió su perspectiva y ahora ve todo lo que ella logró y se alegra por las cosas que pudo hacer y todo eso es gracias al apoyo de las capacitaciones. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cochinilla.
texts.en:
Nerida is a member of the Señor de los Milagros Communal Bank. She is 62 years old and buys and sells groceries and food at street markets. Currently she is beginning to buy and sell cochineal (a red dye made from the cochineal insect). 

Nerida is the mother of four and has been a member of Finca Perú for three years. She feels she has made great progress in her personal and family life. She is grateful to Finca for all the help it has given her.  She remembers and appreciates that previously she was only on the farm and did not see everything she was capable of doing. Upon becoming a part of Finca, she broadened her perspective and now sees all that she has achieved. She is happy because of the things she was able to do, all of which is thanks to the support she received in the training workshops.

Now she will invest her loan in the purchase of cochineal.

loans.use: to purchase cochineal (a red dye made from the cochineal insect)

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba cooks kenkey* for sale. In the photo, in front of Aba is the maize she uses in preparing her kenkey. She serves it with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Dompoase near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has 7 dependents.  Aba has been in this business for 20 years now.  She uses her income for the general upkeep of their children.  Aba will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her kenkey.  

*fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves, often accompanied by fried fish

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Na We Cam-Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Na We Cam II” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left is Emma who is the leader of this group. Emma was born in Makeni. Forty-five year old Emma is married to a trader and the couple has five children.

Emma sells market food – margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying a larger quantity of market-food to add to her stall.

loans.use: to buy margi, salt, pepper, dried fish, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: True Sisters Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “True Sisters” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 1,400,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Maritatu. Mariatu was born in Kambia, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary school. Mariatu sells provisions – milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, etc.. She has been a businesswoman for 17 years now. She is going to use her share of this loan to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Together We Tinap Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Together We Tinap” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 3,000,000.00 Sierra Leone (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Abdul is the leader of this group. The thirty-three-year-old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children. Abdul has been a businessman for ten years now. He sells shoes/ sandals. With his share of this loan, he will buy a large quantity of sandals to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of sandals to add to his business

loans.name: Women In Action Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Women in Action” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Aminata is the leader of this group. Aminata is thirty four years old, married with four children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Aminata sells market food like palm oil, onion, pepper, salt, fish, etc. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now. With the help of this loan, Aminata will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her stall.

loans.use: to buy market food like palm oil, onion, pepper, salt, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy parts for his car.

loans.name: God- Gee Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “God Gee” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek for a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Hawa, pictured on the left. Hawa was born in Makeni, about 27 years ago. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver and her child is still not of school-going age. Hawa has been selling onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. for 8 years now. She will use her share of this loan to buy onions, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, palm oil, pepper, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pepper, fish, margi, salt, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Odonbileg

texts.en:
Odonbileg, 29, sells casual clothes in a shopping mall which is located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running this business for 5 years with his wife and usually they have a lot of customers. Now he lives with his family in his father-in-law’s apartment in the suburban district of the city.  

Initially this couple started their business by retail sales from their home and sometimes sales by phone calls around the offices.  Now he needs to increase the working capital for bigger sales volume.  It is beneficial to run their business successfully and raise their family's income. This loan he is taking will be dedicated to the purchase of more casual clothes from the suppliers.

loans.use: To the purchase of more casual clothes for increasing the sales volume

loans.name: Gerardo Daniel

texts.es:
Gerardo es un joven de 21 años, trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad conocida por sus Dunas, las cuales son visitadas por infinidad de turistas en todo el año al igual que la laguna de “Huacachina”, así como también se cultiva uno de los mejores algodones del mundo y el cultivo de espárragos. En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con su amigo y sus vecinos de su barrio; también le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo escabeche (platillo a base de cebolla aderezada con ají vinagre y otros ingredientes y se le agrega una pieza de pollo); el estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar odontología.

Día a día Gerardo trabaja muy duro en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi; trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque recorre muchas calles en el día en busca de clientes y sobre todo da un trato amable.

Gerardo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, con lo cual tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y más seguro para el transporte de los clientes, asi los clientes tendrán más confianza al tomar sus servicios y le permitirá seguir trabajando para realizar su gran sueño:”comprarse un automóvil”
texts.en:
Gerardo is a young man of 21 years, and an enthusiastic worker.  He lives in the city of Ica, a city known for its sand dunes, which are visited extensively by tourists year-round, as well as Lake Huacachina.  Some of the best cotton and asparagus in the world are grown there.  

In his spare time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He also likes to indulge in one of his favorite dishes, which is the very rich escabeche (a dish with a base of onion seasoned with chili vinegar and other ingredients, with a piece of chicken added).  

He has a fifth-grade education, but he would have liked to study dentistry.  Daily, Gerardo works very hard at his rickshaw business, where he is  a driver.  He works about eight hours a day and can attend to as many as 30 customers in a day.  He believes he does well with his business because he covers a lot of streets during the day in search of customers and, above all, he treats them well.  

Gerardo is very grateful for Kiva’s loans.  Thanks to that support, he has been able to maintain his vehicle, ensuring its good condition, so that his clients will have more confidence in using his services and allowing him to continue working so he can reach his big dream:  “to buy himself a car”.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 48 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 5 años; allí  se dedica al oficio de fotografía profesional en eventos, como cumpleaños, grados, primeras comuniones etc. Inicialmente aprendió a través de un amigo y posteriormente se dedicó a especializarse mediante la formación  en cursos específicos, lo cual le ha permitido el perfeccionamiento de su trabajo y se dedicó con ello a  captar una clientela, que hoy lo identifica en la ciudad. Como su  meta es tener su propio estudio y un almacén de accesorios asociados, su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios como estuches, suvenires, portarretratos y adecuará su propio estudio fotográfico. Con esta inversión logrará continuar impulsando su negocio y muy seguramente aumentará y diversificará sus servicios, lo cual es  lo que traerá mayores utilidades y por consiguiente el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Luis is 48 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla with his wife and his two children, ages 4 and 5 years.  He makes a living as a professional photographer at events such as birthdays, graduations, first communions, etc.  

He originally learned through a friend and later was able to specialize through a combination of specific courses, which has allowed him to perfect his work and devote himself to building clientele, which today helps him stand out in the city.  

As his goal is to have his own studio and a store for camera accessories, his major challenge is to have sufficient working capital to achieve that.  This is exactly the reason he is applying for credit with Kiva, the first funding which is made to the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy accessories like cases, souvenirs, picture frames, and make his own photography studio adequate.  

With this investment he will be able to continue operating his business and surely augment and diversify his services, which will be more useful, resulting in a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy accessories such as cases, souvenirs, picture frames, and to make his own photography studio adequate.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros, tiene 59 años, es madre de 6 hijos, se dedica a la venta y compra de ropa y frutas para las ferias, es socia desde hace 7 años, aunque se retiró un tiempo a raíz de la enfermedad de su madre que después falleció, ella siempre recordaba Finca y decidió volver, siempre le gusto mucho el ahorro las capacitaciones porque le ayudaron a poder formar bien a sus hijos y ser una buena negociante, todo lo aprendió en Finca. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of Señor de los Milagros Communal Bank.  She is 59 years old and the mother of six children.  She works buying and selling clothing and fruit for the markets.  She has been a member for seven years, although she left for a while because of her sick mother, who later died.

She always remembered FINCA and she decided to return.  She always liked the savings and the trainings a lot because they helped her to be able to raise her children well and to be a good businesswoman.  She learned everything in FINCA.

Now, she will invest the loan in buying clothing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Growing up in Argentina, Ruben has had a love for the arts all of his life. When he came to the United States, he wanted to continue to expand his love by setting up a network where artist of all kinds could meet and perform. At first, this began as a hobby, but as it grew in popularity, Ruben decided to turn it into a formal business. 

Two years ago, he founded the New York City Business Club as a public relations business focused on producing musical performances and theater pieces. Ruben concentrates on bringing artist from various fields together and works to give them mass public exposure. At this time, he is hosting an initiative to bring Latin American performers to New York City stages. 

Ruben currently rents all of his equipment to produce shows. However, as he puts on more performances, the cost of rent does not make sense. He would like to purchase equipment such as sound equipment and lighting equipment for his company to use. He would also like to use this loan to start a marketing campaign to further promote the artists.

loans.use: to purchase stage equipment to produce shows.

loans.name: María Carmelina

texts.es: María Carmelina de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos. Ella posee venta de especias, pimienta, canela, achote entre otros, últimamente se ha aumentado la demanda de su producto, pues a la clientela le gusta condimentar sus comidas con las especias de primera calidad que comercia además el precio es realmente accesible y el servicio es único; María es una mujer trabajadora siempre está a la orden de las oportunidades, quiere llegar al éxito por  eso su más grande secreto es la constancia y el amor a su labor,  es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pimienta, canela, achote, grapas, cartón, etc. María Carmelina tiene confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
María Carmelina, 44 years old, lives with her husband and their four children.  She sells spices, pepper, cinnamon, achiote (seeds of the annatto tree used for their coloring effect or as seasoning in food), and other products.  Recently, demand for her products has increased, since her customers like to flavor their food with high quality spices that are sold at accessible prices with unique service.  

María is a hard-working woman who is always ready for opportunities.  She wants to succeed and for that reason her biggest secret is the constancy and love of her work, so she has decided to ask INTEGRAL for credit that will allow her to buy pepper, cinnamon, achiote, staples, cardboard, etc.  María Carmelina has confidence that this way she will succeed in giving her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy pepper, cinnamon, achiote, staples and cardboard.

loans.name: Mauricio Walberto

texts.es: Mauricio Walberto de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una panadería en el lugar de su residencia y vende variedad de pan dulce y salado, quesadillas, tortas secas, salpores, poleadas entre otros, todo hecho con material de primera calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es único; Mauricio es un hombre emprendedor con grandes metas a futuro, piensa que hay que concentrar los afanes de la voluntad en el gran objetivo de la vida, es por eso que se concentró en solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar, levadura, gas propano etc. Mauricio Walberto tiene la confianza que así podrá llevar a su hogar una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Mauricio Walberto is 38 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own house.  He has a bakery in his home and he sells a variety of sweet bread and savories, quesadillas, tortas secas (pastries similar to pies), salpores (traditional Salvadoran pastries), poleadas (Salvadoran custard), and other items, all made with high-quality ingredients and sold at reasonable prices.  In addition, his service is unique.  

Mauricio is an enterprising man with big goals for the future.  He thinks it is important to focus his hard work on big life goals, and it is for that reason that he focused on asking INTEGRAL for credit that would allow him to buy flour, sugar, yeast, propane gas, etc.  Mauricio Walberto has the confidence that this way he will be able to get his household in the best economic state.

loans.use: to by flour, sugar, yeast and propane gas.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells maize at Dompoase near Elmina, which she has done for some years now. Ekua is a widow and has five dependants. As a single parent she uses her income to feed and clothe her  children and and pay their school fees. Ekua will use her loan to purchases bags of maize to sell.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells oranges and plantain at Dompoase near Elmina. Esi has been in this business for the past 10 years now. She is married with seven children and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up keep of their family. Esi will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of oranges and plantain to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of oranges and plantain to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and divides her time between a number of economic activities. She primarily runs a catering service from her house in which she prepares boxed lunches, meals and refreshments for events or institutional orders. For example, clients may request her service for a wedding, baptism, or party. Additionally, she spends some of her time working as an independent assessor for a cancer insurance provider, among other things. Maria has three children who are living independently and she is separated from her husband. As such, she has lately been very focused on her business endeavors.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to renew her kitchen equipment. The loan will help her purchase a blender, plates, and a new refrigerator. Maria’s dream is to open a large food preparation center outside of her house, but for this she needs more capital. Through the help of Arariwa, little by little, she is working her way toward fulfilling this ambition.

Maria is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment such as a blender, plates, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells maize at Dompoase near Elmina, which she has done for some years now. Ekua is a widow and has five dependants. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Ekua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a single parent who lives together with her six children at Dompoase near Elmina.  Aba sells maize. She has been selling maize for the past five years. As a single parent, she uses her income  for the general up keep of her children. Aba will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Aba wishes to plant maize herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz and her partner operate a number of small businesses to support themselves and their four-year-old. Beatriz operates a small cart where she sells hard-boiled quail eggs, which are a common snack in Peru. Passersby usually purchase a bag of five eggs with some aji (spicy sauce) for S/.1 (equivalent to about $0.40). In addition, Beatriz purchases Bolivian earrings and sells them by walking through the streets or markets during weekdays. She has been engaged in these activities for about 10 years.

Beatriz would like a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her businesses, primarily quail eggs and earrings at wholesale. With continued success, she hopes to have her own stand in the market in the future.

Beatriz is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy quail eggs and earrings for her businesses

loans.name: Magaly Esther

texts.es: Magaly con su credikiva compró bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, libretas y papeleria en general, que vendió y amplió un poco su capital de trabajo. Cada vez mas en Malambo, el municipio donde habita y tiene su negocio, auemnta su clientela y eso es muy bueno para ella.  En la actualidad está aplicando un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará una vez mas,  bolsos y calzado que le encargaron sus potenciales compradores al revisar su catálogo,tambien surtirá su vitrina con papelería para despertar nuevamente la atención, el interés y la acción de compra de sus clientes. Su mensaje a los finaciadors de Kiva es el siguiente: " Estoy muy agradecida por el crédito ya que es por una buena ayuda para hacer crecer mi negocio me he esmerado por pagarlo bien para que me continuen apoyando"
texts.en:
With her credikiva, Magaly bought bags, shoes, cosmetics, books and general stationery which she sold and increased her working capital a little. 

In Malambo, the town where Magaly lives and has her business, her clientele has been increasing and this is very good for her. She is currently applying for a new credikiva which she will once again use to buy bags and shoes which potential buyers have requested from her catalogue, and she will also stock her display cabinet with new stationery to reawaken attention, interest and purchasing action among her customers. 

Her message to the Kiva lenders is: "I am very grateful for the loan because it is a great help to grow my business. I have made ​​efforts to pay well so that you continue to support me"

loans.use: to purchase bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells maize porridge and bread at Dompoase near Elmina, which she has done for five years now. She is a single parent. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and flour for the preparation of her porridge and bread for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory for his furniture business

loans.name: Carmen Rosario

texts.es: Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales está educando actualmente a uno, tiene más de 12 años en Finca Perú como socia, es casada, se dedica a la venta de granos como trigo, maíz, quinua, etc.; también vende medicina naturaly productos esotéricos como perfumes , velas etc. Gracias Finca pudo comprarse sus cosas y también se compró su terreno e hizo su casa. Donde también invirtió en la educación de sus hijos, estando en su banquito aprendió a ahorrar. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de sus productos esotericos a si como en la medicina natural.
texts.en: Carmen is a member of the Yachay Wasi Communal Bank. She is 53 years old, she is married and she has 3 children, and she is currently paying for the education of one of them. She has been a member of Finca Peru for more than 12 years. She sells basic grains such as wheat, maize and quinoa; she also sells natural medicines and esoteric products such as perfumes and candles. Thanks to Finca she has been able to buy things for her as well as buying some land where she had her house built. She also invested in the education of her children, and working with her communal bank has taught her how to save money. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy esoteric products as well as natural medicines.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines and esoteric products.

loans.name: Guzmary

texts.es:
Guzmary pertenece al banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y sus reuniones con sus compañeras del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. 

La socia Guzmary es soltera ella es una persona empeñosa y responsable ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una institucion privada ,ella trabaja durante el dia ,la socia a la vez es contadora de profesion ,siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante,la socia desea poder seguir estudiando para tener un mejor futuro.

La socia desea el prestamo para pagar los gastos de su titulo profesional. 

Guzmary agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Guzmary is a member of the “Choquequirao” Communal Bank, pertaining to the Arariwa Association of Cusco. Their reunions occur every 30 days in the city, province, and department of Cusco.

Guzmary is single and a very hard-working, responsible person who alternates her daily activities with her job in a private entity where she works during the day.  She is an accountant by profession and earns a living this way.  She wants to continue her educatrion for a better future.

The loan she is requesting is to pay for her professional title.

Guzmary is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To pay for her professional title.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace más de año y medio, es casada. Tiene una pastelería y se dedica a la venta de pasteles, gracias a los préstamos recibidos se compró sus mesas y aumentó su producción, con sus ahorros pudo educar a sus hijos, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como leche, azúcar, harina, etc.
texts.en: Sonia is a member of the communal bank Yachay Wasi.  She is 30 years old, married and the mother of two children.  For over a year and a half she has been a member of FINCA Peru.  She has a bakery and sells pastry for a living.  Thanks to previous loans she was able to buy tables and increase production.  With her savings she has been able to give her children an education.  The loan she is requesting now is to buy goods such as milk, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar and flour.

loans.name: El Nanchito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "El  Nanchito"  y esta conformado por once mujeres trabajadoras con deseos de mejorar sus pequeños negocios y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos ya que todas trabajan para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos  que son el futuro de este país.
Todas son originarias de la ciudad de Pinotepa  donde se baila mucho las chilenas y donde la mayoría de los ciudadanos son personas indígenas que necesitan la ayuda de fundacion para mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Cecilia de 42 años de edad, es una señora trabajadora y humilde  con deseos de hacer crecer su negocio.
Doña Ceci como mejor la conocen sus compañeras  de grupo se dedica a la venta de  verduras desde  hace  tres años.
Doña Ceci además de vender de verduras también se  dedica a dar clases en una escuela de su comunidad.
Ella nos  cuenta que desde muy pequeña le llamo la atención dar clases y ayudar a los niños que  padecen de lento aprendizaje.
Ella nos cuenta una de sus  experiencias en su negocio: *cuando empezó a dar clases decidió vender verduras para obtener mas ingresos, pero no sabia como empezar, después se dio cuenta de los beneficios de fundación y fue así como inicio su negocio  ya que gracias al apoyo de fundacion  su negocio crece cada día mas y así obtiene mas ganancias para poder ayudar a su sobrina Maria del Rosario a quien quiere mucho  y por quien trabaja  dando clases y vendiendo verduras*.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más verdura como es: Papa, chile, tomate, calabacita, chayote, zanahorias, jitomate verde, cilantro, lechuga y papaya.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por apoyar a las mujeres trabajadoras que desean mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Bernarda Alejandrina -quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Primitiva Balbina-quien se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Austreberta  Virginia -quien se dedica a la venta de masa y nixtamal.
Yolanda-quien se dedica a la venta de carnes frías.
Alba  Leonila -quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Gloria Rosalba-quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Gloria Josefa-quien se dedica a la venta  de abarrotes.
Isabel Josefa-quien se dedica a la venta de paletas de hielo.
Yolanda-quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Claudia Eva -quien se dedica a la venta de chiles y semillas.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por  darles los recursos a las personas que desean superarse y tener un negocio para darles una mejor vida a sus familias y principalmente a los niños.
texts.en:
This group is called "El Nanchito" and is comprised of 11 hard-working women who want to improve their small businesses and their childrens' quality of life.  All of them strive to give their children a better life for the future of the country.

All are from the city of Pinotepa where "las chilenas" dancing is popular and where most of the inhabitants are indigenous and need the foundation's help to improve their lives.

One of the members of the group is Mrs. Cecilia, 42, who is a hard-working, humble woman who wants to expand her business.  Doña Ceci, as she is known by her colleagues in the group, has been selling vegetables for three years.  She also teaches at the community school and claims that from a very young age she was always interested in teaching and helping children with slow learning skills.

She tells us about one of her business experiences.  When she started teaching she decided to sell vegetables as a way to increase her income, but did not know how to get started.  Later she learned about the foundation's loan program and started her business thanks to help from the foundation.  Her business is growing daily and she is earning enough to help her niece, Maria del Rosario, who she loves very much and works for, teaching and selling vegetables.

She has requested a loan to buy more vegetables such as: potatoes, chili peppers, tomatoes, zucchini, squash, carrots, green tomatoes, coriander, lettuce and papaya.  She is grateful to the foundation for supporting working women who want to improve their family's lifestyles.

The other members of the group are:

Bernarda Alejandrina - who sells Mexican snacks.
Primitiva Balbina - who sells cheese.
Austreberta  Virginia - who sells dough and nixtamal.
Yolanda - who sells fried meats.
Alba  Leonila - who sells clothing.
Gloria Rosalba - who sells softdrinks.
Gloria Josefa - who sells groceries.
Isabel Josefa - who sells popsicles.
Yolanda - who sells food.
Claudia Eva - who sells chili peppers and seeds.

They are grateful to the foundation for giving people the resources to get ahead and go into business so they can give their families, especially the children, a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta has owned a small grocery store for about five years, where she sells basic needs such as vegetables, canned foods, sugar, rice, pasta, oil, beef, and chicken. She also stocks beverages such as soda and milk. She is 46 years old and married with three children who are 4, 23, and 27 years old. Typically, Marta wakes up early to open her store at 6 a.m. and works until 8 p.m. seven days a week. 

Marta is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise such as vegetables, canned foods, sugar, and milk. Marta’s current shop is 6 x 8 meters and she dreams of moving her business to a larger space in the future.

Marta is a new member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as vegetables, canned foods, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is originally from Quillabamba but currently lives in Cusco with her husband. Angelica is 56 years old and has four children. Two of them are studying at the university and the others are living independently. Angelica and her husband run a guest house in their home. They provide lodging and meals primarily to students who have come from other parts of the province. Angelica’s house has three rooms that she rents.

Angelica is requesting a loan in order to make home improvements. Specifically, she wants to fix two bathrooms, which are now very old. The loan will be used to buy materials such as ceramic wall tiles. Angelica hopes that one day she will be able to open a hotel in her hometown of Quillabamba.

Angelica is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to fix two bathrooms and replace wall tiles

loans.name: Deny

texts.en:
Deny used to work at a printing house, but now she works independently washing and ironing clothes in her clients’ houses. She is 28 years old and raising three young children with her partner. Her children are 1, 5, and 7 years old. Last year, Deny purchased a car and she is requesting a loan in order to finish her car payments. Her dream is to own a house in which she can open a small grocery store.

Deny is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to make car payments

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris and her partner have a carpentry studio where they manufacture and sell wooden furniture. They produce tables, chairs, beds, doors, and dining room sets among other things. They have had this business for about three years, operating from a rented location. Doris is requesting a loan in order to purchase wood and finishings such as lacquer and wood stain. Her dream is to have a large store to display and sell furniture.

Doris is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: To purchase wood, lacquer, and wood stain

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José es socio del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi, tiene 29 años de edad, no tiene hijos y es soltero, se dedica a la venta de cereales, tiene más de 1 año como socio, gracia a Finca Perú esta educándose y está estudiando en la universidad, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en compra de cereales.
texts.en: José is a member of the communal bank Yachay Wasi.  He is 29, single and has no children.  He sells cereals for a living and has been a member for over a year.  Thanks to Finca Perú, he is studying at the university.  The loan will be used to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cereals.

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es: Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi, tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos actualmente mantiene solo a uno, es socia de FINCA Perú hace mas de 1 año, se dedica a la venta de cereales en las ferias, en este corto tiempo solo mejoró su negocio en poca cantidad, y está aprendiendo a ahorrar, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en compra de cereales para llevar a las ferias.
texts.en: Norma is a member of the Yachay Wasi Communal Bank. She is 47 years old, she is a single mother of two children, one of whom she is still providing for. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than one year, and she engages in selling cereals in the fairs. In this short time there has been only a little improvement in her activity, and she is learning how to save money. The loan she in requesting will be used to buy cereals to sell them in the fairs.

loans.use: To buy cereals at wholesale price.

loans.name: Visión Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Visión Hacia el Futuro” está conformado por 21 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía en cerámica, venta de astillas de madera, confección de ropa, servicio de juegos electrónicos, venta de abarrotes, venta de plantas, venta de lencería y venta de artículos para la casa. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Viviana tesorera del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pie, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, usa una polera color rojo y su cabello está recogido, el cual es de color negro.
Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de lavandería, desde hace tres años. Trabaja los fines de semana en horario flexible, ya que sus clientes fijos son trabajadores de una planta de celulosa. Comenta que la temporada de más alta demanda es durante el invierno.
Trabaja desde su casa y ahí cuenta con dos lavadoras. Utiliza diferentes productos de limpieza, específicamente detergente, cloro para ropa color y blanca, además de suavizante para la ropa. Toda esta mercadería la compra en supermercados.
Con el crédito comprará detergente para continuar prestando servicios de lavandería.
Una de sus metas es formalizar su negocio, para esto ya se encuentra realizando los trámites necesarios.
Viviana vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 7 y 5 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener su casa propia, ya que postuló al subsidio habitacional y la construcción de su nueva vivienda está en proceso.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. 
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal ella se siente muy cómoda, ya que comparten actividades en conjunto y los integrantes son muy comprometidos.
Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender administrar de mejor manera su negocio e ingresos.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Visión Hacia el Futuro'.  It has 21 members who are all entrepreneurs.  They all work in different fields including making pottery, selling woodchips, making clothing, providing an electronic games service, selling groceries, selling plants, selling lingerie and selling household items.  They all live in the town of Chillán.

Viviana is the bank's treasurer.  In the photo she is standing on the far left, wearing a red top, with her black hair tied back. 

Viviana has been providing a laundry service for three years.  She works flexible hours on a weekend as her regular customers work in a pulp mill.  She says that her peak season is winter.

Viviana works from home where she has two washing machines.  She uses different cleaning products, specifically detergents, bleach for coloreds and whites and also fabric softener.  She buys all this merchandise in supermarkets.  She will use her loan to buy detergents so that she can continue providing a laundry service.

One of Viviana's goals is to make her business official and she is already completing the necessary paperwork.  Viviana lives together with her husband and her two daughters who are 7 and 5 years old.  Her dream, on a personal level, is to buy her own home.  She has applied for a housing grant and her new house is in the process of being built.

Viviana is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza as it will allow her to invest in her business.  She feels very comfortable with her community bank as they carry out activities as a team and the members are all very committed.  The training sessions have helped her to learn how to better manage her business and her income.

Chillán is a town in the central-south region of Chile.  Its name means 'Chair of the Sun' in Mapundungun (the language of our Mapuche ancestors).  Chillán is known as 'The Cradle of the Nation' or 'The Land of Artists' owing to the fact that it is the birthplace of a number of notable Chileans such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy detergents

loans.name: Los Arbolitos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Los Arbolitos y esta conformado  por doce mujeres trabajadoras y humildes originarias de pinotepa, las integrantes de este grupo se consideran mujeres  con sueños y fuerzas para cumplir lo que se propongan como es mejor su vida y su comunidad.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora  Rosa Elia de 58 años de edad tiene, ella tiene cinco hijos  tres mujeres y dos varones quienes ya están casados  y con hijos.
Doña Rosa Elia vive con su mamá, ella se dedica a la venta de pan y de refrescos desde hace veinte años.
Ella nos cuenta que  antes solamente vendía pan pero solamente por menudeo, pero con el paso del tiempo  y con el apoyo de fundacion compro mas  pan para venderlo por mayoreo y menudeo, nos dice que sale a las calles de su comunidad a vender pan por las mañanas y las tardes  mientras su mamá y sus nietos la van  ha visitar se quedan vendiendo pan  en la casa.
Nos cuenta que esta muy contenta ya que con el apoyo  de fundacion  va comprar mas pan para la venta y refrescos de diferentes sabores para que sus vecinos le vayan a comprar refrescos a la  hora de la comida.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por apoyarla y hacer que sus sueños se realicen.
Las integrantes de este grupo son:
Agustina – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Teresa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Catalina- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Rosalía- se dedica a la venta de agua de garrafón.
Julia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Beatriz- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Vitalina- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Lizbet- se dedica a  la venta de ropa.
Flora- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Georgina- se dedica a la venta de joyas.
Maria Claudia- se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadora y humildes con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Los Arbolitos' and it has 12 members who are all hard-working and unassuming women from Pinotepa.  The group's members consider themselves to be women with dreams and the strength to achieve what they set out to achieve, namely to improve their lives and their communities. 

One of this group's members is 58-year-old Rosa Elia.  She has five children, three daughters and two sons, who are already married and have children of their own.

Rosa Elia lives with her mom.  Her business is selling bread and soft drinks.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She tells us that she used to sell only bread and she only sold it retail.  However, over time and with the support of Fundación Realidad, she bought more bread so that she could sell both wholesale and retail.  She tells us that she goes out into the streets of her community to sell her bread in the mornings and afternoons while her mom and grandchildren stay at home selling bread.  She tells us that she is very happy because, with the support of Fundación Realidad, she will be able to buy more bread to sell.  She will also buy soft drinks in different flavors so that her neighbors buy drinks from her at meal time.

Rosa Elia thanks Fundación Realidad for supporting her and making her dreams come true.  The other members of this group are:

Agustina, who sells Mexican snacks
Teresa, who sells Mexican snacks
Catalina, who sells bread
Rosalía, who sells water in demijohns
Julia, who sells Mexican snacks
Beatriz, who sells Mexican snacks
Vitalina, who sells Mexican snacks
Lizbet, who sells clothing
Flora, who sells bread
Georgina, who sells jewelry
Maria Claudia, who sells Mexican snacks.

They are all grateful to Fundación Realidad for helping hard-working and unassuming women who have a desire to do well in life.

loans.use: to buy bread and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria Carlas

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando  un nuevo préstamo, pues su interés en crecer en el negocio le motiva a seguir trabajando con financiamientos para invertir en blusas, faldas, jeans, lencería, con esto espera atraer más clientes y mejorar el nivel de ventas.
Ella  tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, pues ha logrado estabilizar el negocio y ganarse clientes, tambien sus ganancias han mejorado la condición familiar.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan as her interest in growing her business encourages her to continue working with loans.  She will invest her money in buying blouses, skirts, jeans and underwear.  She hopes that this will attract more customers and improve her sales.

Ana's previous loan had a positive effect as she managed to stabilize her business and gain customers.  Her profits have also improved her family's situation.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, jeans and underwear

loans.name: Las Flores Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Flores Triunfadoras  y esta conformado por trece mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que se dedican diversas actividades económicas.
Los integrantes de este grupo son originarios de un pueblo llamado Rancho viejo es un  pueblo rico en flora   antes de llegar a la comunidad esta un rió llamado rió de la arena es un rió grande con  árboles verdes.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo  es la señora  Verónica  de 30 años de edad  es, una señora trabajadora y humilde que se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes desde hace dos años.
Nos dice que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  comprar su mercancía a tiempo y  tener limpia su tienda y darles un buen servicio a sus clientes  para  que ellos estén contentos y orgullosos de su tienda y de quien los atiende.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Rolando de  treinta y cinco años de edad un señor trabajador y humilde quien apoya a su esposa para que los dos juntos le den un mejor futuro a sus hijos Rober de cinco años de edad y Abies de dos años de edad.
Ella nos cuenta uno que hace tiempo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa por catalogo  pero  en ocasiones  no obtenía ganancias y le comento su esposo  que si  con sus ahorros podían comprar un poco de mercancía de abarrotes para la venta  así que los dos decidieron que seria un buen negocio  y con la ayuda de fundacion compraron mas mercancía y engrandecieron  su tienda de abarrotes.
Ella va utilizar el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía de abarrotes como es: Jabon, detergente, refrescos, yogurt, mayonesa, chiles, sabritas, sopa, café, azucar, leche, pan, aceite, verduras, jugos y pasta dental.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las mujeres de pueblos indígenas con deseos de superación.
Las integrantes del grupo son:
Carmen- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Angelina Maricela - se dedica ala venta de materias primas.
Sara Maria de la Luz - se dedica a la venta de  refrescos.
Bertha- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Cristina- se dedica a la venta de alhajas.
Maximina-se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Alfoncina- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Lizbeth- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Carmela- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Catalina Berta- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Brigida Felicitas- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Elsa- se dedica a la venta de  quesos.

Le dan las  gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras y por darles la oportunidad  de superarse y mejorar su comunidad con sus  pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Flores Triunfadoras and it is made up of thirteen hardworking and humble women who have different economic activities. The members of this group are from a town called Rancho Viejo. It is a town that is rich in flora. Before arriving at this community there is a river called Rió de la Arena a large river with green trees. 

ONe of the members of this group is called Verónica, who is 30 years old. She is a hardworking and humble woman who has sold store merchandise for 2 years. She tells us that what she likes the most about her business is buying her merchandise on time and keeping her store clean and giving her customers good service so they'll be happy and proud of her store and the person who is serving them.  

She is happily married to Rolando, who is thirty five. He is a hardworking and humble man who supports his wife so that they two of them can give a better future to their children Rober, who is five, and Abies, who is two.

She tells us that she used to sell clothing via catalog, but at times she didn't earn anything. She told her husband that they could buy a little bit of store merchandise to sell with their savings. So they both decided it would be a good business and with help from the foundation they bought more merchandise and enlarged their grocery store.

She is going to use the loan to buy more store merchandise such as: soap, detergent, beverages, yogurt, mayonnaise, chiles, potato chips, soup, coffee, sugar, milk, bread, oil, vegetables, juices and toothpaste. She is grateful to the foundation for helping women from indigenous communities who want to get ahead. 

The members of the group are:  

Carmen- she sells Mexican snacks.  
Angelina Maricela - she sells raw materials
Sara Maria de la Luz- she sells beverages
Bertha- she sells bread
Cristina- she sells jewelry
Maximina-she sells chicken
Alfoncina- she sells Mexican snacks.
Lizbeth- she sells shoes.
Carmela- she sells store merchandise.
Catalina Berta- she sells Mexican snacks
Brigida Felicitas- she sells Mexican snacks.
Elsa- she sells cheese.

They are grateful to the foundation for helping working women and for giving them the opportunity to get ahead and improve their community with their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy store merchandise to sell.

location.town: Rancho Viejo, San Andres Huaxpaltepec. Oaxaca

loans.name: Casa De La Monarca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre “Casa de la Monarca”, está ubicado en la comunidad de "la Mesa" en el municipio de San José del Rincón muy cerca del Estado de Michoacán, este nombre lo eligió el grupo de forma democrática ya que comentan que cada año las mariposas monarcas llegan a Michoacán y a su comunidad, esto les agrada mucho a ellos, reciben a las mariposas con mucha alegría ya que saben que forman parte de su entorno y les agradan mucho, esto fue lo que motivó a la gente a ponerle este nombre a su grupo, su comunidad tiene una vista bellísima ya que está en lo alto de las montañas y se pueden apreciar muy bien grandes cadenas de verdes árboles que además son muy hermosos, el grupo lo conforman 11 mujeres emprendedoras, amables, optimistas, alegres y sobre todo muy responsables. Las integrantes del grupo  y sus actividades son las siguientes:
1.- Raquel G. (compra de 2 borregos para venta)
2.- María Elena C. (compra de guajolotes y pollos para vender)
3.- Berenice R. (compra de guajolotes y pollos para venta)
4.- Juana G. (compra de abarrotes para venta)
5.- María Guadalupe S. (compra de pollos para vender)
6.- Guillermina S. (compra de 3 borregos para vender)
7.- Jenoveva S. (compra de abarrotes y mantenimiento de un molino de maíz) 
8.-  Ángela F. (compra de artículos de papelería para venta)
9.-  Erika P. (compra de borregos para vender)
10.- María Luisa G. (compra de guajolotes para vender)
11.- Eulalia P. (compra de pollos para venta)
Doña María Luisa es integrante y representante de este grupo, es una persona de 40 años de edad que se dedica al trabajo en el hogar, se encuentra casada desde hace 22 años con el señor Arturo quien es conductor de un taxi particular. La señora María es muy optimista y tiene una iniciativa que motiva a quien la escucha, ella solicita este préstamo para la compra de 25 guajolotes y alimento para criarlos, ella compra los guajolotes en un municipio cercano a su localidad de nombre El Oro, Estado de México, los lleva a su casa donde los cría durante 4 meses aproximadamente y después los vende en su comunidad con sus conocidos, ella y su esposo tienen 3 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando uno en la secundaria y los otros dos en la primaria, todos ellos viven en una casa propia. “Pienso que este crédito es algo muy favorable porque quiero obtener un buen rendimiento, llevo ya 5 años de experiencia y me atrevo a decir que sí se puede a pesar de las dificultades, hace tiempo me enfermé y no pude atender a mis animalitos durante 2 meses, eso no fue bueno, pero afortunadamente estoy mejor y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando, las metas que tengo son muchas, me gustaría tener mi propia granja, además si me gusta hacerlo, tenerles cuidado y estar al pendiente de ellos, sé que con esta actividad yo apoyo mucho a mi esposo y a mi familia".
texts.en:
This group is called 'Casa de la Monarca' (Home of the Monarch).  It is located in 'La Mesa' community, in the town of San José del Rincón, very near The State of Michoacán.  The group voted on this name because they say that every year Monarch butterflies come to Michoacán and to their community.  They are really happy about this and they receive the butterflies with a lot of happiness because they know that they are a part of their environment and they like them a lot.  This is why they gave their group the name they did.  Their community has beautiful views because it is high up in the mountains and they have a very good view of large swathes of green trees which are very beautiful.  The group has 11 members who are all female entrepreneurs.  They are friendly, optimistic, happy and, above all, responsible.  The members of the group and their business activities are as follows:
1.- Raquel G. (will buy two lambs to sell)
2.- María Elena C. (will buy turkeys and chickens to sell)
3.- Berenice R. (will buy turkeys and chickens to sell)
4.- Juana G. (will buy groceries to sell)
5.- María Guadalupe S. (will buy chickens to sell)
6.- Guillermina S. (will buy three lambs to sell)
7.- Jenoveva S. (will buy groceries and have maintenance work carried out on her corn mill) 
8.-  Ángela F. (will buy stationery products to sell)
9.-  Erika P. (will buy lambs to sell)
10.- María Luisa G. (will buy turkeys to sell)
11.- Eulalia P. (will buy chickens to sell)

María Luisa is a member and representative of this group.  She is 40 years old and a homemaker.  She has been married to Arturo, who is a private taxi driver, for 22 years.  María is very optimistic and she has initiative which motivates whoever listens to her.  She is requesting this loan to buy 25 turkeys and feed with which to raise them.  She buys her turkeys in a nearby town called El Oro, in the State of Mexico.  She takes them home, raises them for approximately four months, and then sells them in her community to people that she knows.  She and her husband have three children who are currently in school.  One is in high school and the other two are in elementary school.  They live in their own home.  "I think this loan is very favorable because I want to achieve a good output.  I have five years experience and I dare to say that everything is possible in spite of difficulties.  Some time ago I became sick and I couldn't care for my animals for two months.  This wasn't good but, fortunately, I am better now and I have a great desire to continue working.  I have a lot of goals.  I would like to own my own farm.  I will care for my animals and be alert to their needs because I know that, through my business, I am really supporting my husband and family".

loans.use: to buy turkeys to sell

loans.name: Yimmy Patricio

texts.es:
YIMMY PATRICIO tiene 29 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo de 5 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

YIMMY PATRICIO es chofer en una compañía de camionetas. Solicita el crédito para comprar un terreno.  Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir un bien para poder alquilar terrenos y sembrar maíz.

La compra la realizará en ventanas. El sueño es poder construir una casa con jardín. El desafío al que se enfrenta es tener estabilidad laboral y seguir trabajando por el hijo.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boley y pasar tiempo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Yimmy Patricio is 29 years old.  He is single and lives together with his 5-year-old son in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Yimmy works as a driver for a truck company.  He is requesting this loan to buy a plot of land.  With the help of this loan he will be able to acquire an asset which will allow him to rent out land and sow corn.

Yimmy will make his purchase in Ventanas.  His dream is to be able to build a house with a yard.  The challenge that he faces is having stability in his work and continuing to work for his son.

In his free time, Yimmy enjoys playing volleyball and spending time with his son.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Santa Rosa Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama Santa Rosa Buena Vista  esta integrado por catorce mujeres  trabajadoras  que se dedican a diferentes  actividades  económicas.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de  un pueblo llamado Santa Rosa es un pueblo  rico en fauna, antes de llegar a la comunidad hay muchos árboles de limón y cultivos de papaya.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora  Elida una señora de  cuarenta años de  edad quien se dedica a la venta de  comida como es: caldo de pollo, caldo de res, caldo de pescado, barbacoa de res, barbacoa de pollo y mole de pollo.
Esta felizmente casada  con el señor Fernado de cuarenta y dos años de edad quien se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la siembra de papaya.
Tiene dos hijos Emmanuel de trece años de edad y Tania de nueve años de edad, ella nos dice que sus hijos son el motivo por el cual ella  trabaja día con día.
Doña Elida nos cuenta como es que tiene su Restaurante llamado Las Delicias ella nos cuenta que anteriormente  vendía mercancía de abarrotes y con sus ganancias  puso una  papelería, de las ganancias de la papelería y la mercancía de abarrotes y con la  ayuda de fundacion  logro abrir su pequeño restaran y comprar ingredientes  para la elaboración de comida.
Doña Elida pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como es: chile verdee chile seco, tomate, cebolla, ajos, aceite, pollos para la elaboración de comida, carne de res y pescado.
Esta muy contenta  por el apoyo de fundacion por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños que engrandecer su negocio.
Las integrantes de este grupo son:
Anastacia-quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Edilia-quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Flora-quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Florencia-quien se dedica a la venta de paletas de hielo.
Elida- quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Erendira-quien se dedica a la venta de  ropa de costura.
Antonia-quien se dedica a la venta  mercancía de abarrotes.
Máxima-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Juana Lorenza -quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ninfa-quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Rosa Luz-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Juana-quien se dedica a la venta de  pescado.
Eloina-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Martha-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les ha  dado para que sus pequeños negocios crezcan y mejoren.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Santa Rosa Buena Vista'.  It has fourteen members who are all hard-working women.  They all carry out different business activities.  They are from a village called Santa Rosa which is rich in wildlife.  Just before you reach their community, there are a lot of lemon trees and papaya crops.

One of the members of this group is Elida.  Elida is 40 years old and her business is selling food such as chicken soup, beef soup, fish stew, barbecued beef, barbecued chicken and 'mole de pollo' (spicy chicken).

Elida is happily married to 42-year-old Fernando who grows corn and papaya.  The couple have two children: 13-year-old Emmanuel and 9-year-old Tania.  She tells us that her children are the reason she works hard day after day.

Elida tells us that she has a restaurant called 'Las Delicias'.  She says that she used to sell groceries and used her profits to set up a stationery store.  With the profits from her stationery store and her grocery store, and with the help of Fundación Realidad, she managed to open her small restaurant and buy ingredients for making meals.

Elida requested this loan to buy more ingredients for making her meals such as green chilis, dried chilis, tomatoes, onions, garlic, oil, chicken, beef and fish.  She is very happy with the support that Fundación Realidad are giving her which helps her to fulfill her dreams of expanding her business.

The members of this group are:
Anastacia, who sells fish
Edilia, who sells fish
Flora, who sells fish
Florencia, who sells ice lollies
Elida, who sells Mexican snacks
Erendira, who sells sewing supplies
Antonia, who sells groceries
Máxima, who sells Mexican snacks
Juana Lorenza, who sells Mexican snacks
Ninfa, who sells fish
Rosa Luz, who sells clothing
Juana, who sells fish
Eloina, who sells clothing
Martha, who sells clothing

They are all grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that they have given them in growing and improving their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Doña Isabel es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Mujeres al Poder, tiene 33 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, que son menores de edad y estudian.  Doña Isabel es una vendedora ambulante, y comercializa ropa para toda la familia, así como ropa intima y zapatos. Además tiene en su propiedad ganado de engorde, que representa una actividad paralela al comercio. 
Isabel está embarazada de su tercer hijo, pero eso no le impide salir a vender por diferentes comunidades para ayudar a los gastos  del hogar, y principalmente para pagar los estudios de sus hijos que es su responsabilidad, ya que con lo que su esposo recibe de salario no alcanza. 
Este es el tercer crédito que solicita y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos, gracias a que actualmente tiene mucha demanda de mercadería, pero no contaba con el dinero para hacer la inversión en capital de trabajo. 
Es grupo al que pertenece Isabel está compuesto por 5 integrantes más, todas señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Isabel is the treasurer of the 'Mujeres al Poder' Women's Bank.  She is 33 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her two children who are dependent on her and still in school.  Isabel is an itinerant street vendor.  She sells clothing for the whole family, as well as underwear and shoes.  She also has livestock on her property which she fattens.  She carries out this business in parallel with her sales business.

Isabel is pregnant with her third child but this doesn't stop her from going out to different communities to sell her products in order to help toward her household expenses and, above all, cover the cost of her children's education.  This is her responsibility because her husband's salary doesn't stretch far enough.

This is the third loan that Isabel has requested and she will invest it in buying clothing and shoes because she currently has a lot of demand for her merchandise but doesn't have the money she needs to make the necessary investment in working capital.

The group to which Isabel belongs has five further members.  They are all responsible and hard-working ladies who will invest in their agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (men's, women's and children's clothing, underwear and shoes)

loans.name: Nuevo Camino Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuevo Camino”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran, venta de ropa, preparación de comida rápida, crianza de chanchos, venta de verduras, artesanía en cerámica, peluquería, producción de queso, venta de cosméticos por catálogo, pastelería y librería, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Carolina integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, ella usa anteojos, su cabello está recogido, el cual es de color castaño oscuro. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a la venta de ropa nueva, para adulto, niños y bebes. Sus ventas las realiza desde su casa y también puerta a puerta, ya que su clientela es fija, lo cual le permite recorrer el sector con seguridad de realizar ventas. Trabaja en este rubro desde hace un año y medio. Comenta que la temporada de más alta demanda es durante los meses de primavera- verano.
Su mercadería la compra al por mayor en el Barrio Patronato (sector comercial que se caracteriza por tener ropa y accesorios nacionales e importados a muy bajos precios) ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para la temporada de otoño invierno. Una de las metas para su negocio, es seguir trabajando y mantenerlo en el tiempo.
Carolina vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 17 y 11 años edad, ambos estudian. Sus sueños a nivel personal, son obtener su casa propia, ya que ahorró dinero suficiente para postular al subsidio habitacional.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo, ella se siente muy cómoda, ya que son unidos y comprometidos. 
Por su parte las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y administración.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Nuevo Camino'.  It has 18 members who are all entrepreneurs and who all work in different fields including: selling clothing, preparing fast food, raising pigs, selling vegetables, making pottery, hairdressing, producing cheese, selling cosmetics through catalogs, making confectionery, selling stationery, etc.  They are all from the town of Chillán.

Carolina is a member of this community bank.  She is in the back row of the photograph, second from the left.  She wears glasses and her dark brown hair is tied back.

Carolina is a saleswoman.  She sells new clothing for adults, children and babies.  She makes her sales from home and also door to door.  She has regular customers and this allows her to move safely around the area to make her sales.  She has been in this business for a year and a half.  She says that her peak season is during the spring and summer months.

Carolina buys her merchandise wholesale in Patronato neighborhood, in the city of Santiago (this is a commercial area which is noted for having domestic and imported clothing and accessories at very low prices). 

Carolina will use her loan to buy fall and winter clothing.  One of her business goals is to continue working and keep her business running over time.  She has saved up enough money to apply for a housing grant.

Carolina is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza as it will allow her to invest in her business.  She feels very comfortable within her group as they are all united and committed people.  The training sessions have helped her to learn new sales and administration strategies.

Chillán is a town in the central-southern area of Chile.  Its name means 'Chair of the Sun' in Mapudungun (the language of our Mapuche ancestors).  Chillán is known as 'The Cradle of the Nation' or 'Land of Artists' because it is the birthplace of a number of well-known figures from Chile's past such as, for example, the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy fall and winter clothing

loans.name: Nery

texts.en:
Nery recently started working as an accountant. Previously, she worked in business administration. She is 48 years old and single with two children, ages 18 and 20, who are currently studying at the university. 

Nery is requesting a loan to fix her house. She has two rooms that she rents to boarders, and she would like to make improvements to the roof, bathroom and floor of her house. Her dream is to buy two more houses for her children.

Nery is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to fix the roof, bathroom and floor of her house.

loans.name: Elva

texts.en:
Elva is 60 years old and has been retired for about three years. She is married and has three children who are now living independently. She used to be a teacher; now she focuses on running her guesthouse. 

In her home, Elva provides lodging and three meals a day to 3 to 4 guests at a time. Elva is requesting a loan in order to purchase cooking ingredients as well as to help pay for water, electricity and gas expenses. Her dream is to enlarge her guesthouse, adding more rooms so that she can accommodate more boarders.  

Elva is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and to pay for water, electricity and gas.

loans.name: Judith Genoveva

texts.en:
Judith is a teacher of gastronomy. She leverages her 15 years of experience as a chef to offer cooking classes to others. She is 44 years old and separated, and she has a five-year-old son. 

Judith has previously worked in hotels and restaurants. This fall, she is planning to open a restaurant of her own. Judith is requesting a loan in order to buy equipment such as a grill and tables. She is excited to start her new venture and hopes that her restaurant will be a success.

Judith is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy a grill and tables for a new restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.en:
Maria has been running a printing press for about 7 to 8 years in a rented space. Her shop produces brochures, books and all sorts of printed material, mostly for institutional clients such as NGOs, including Asociación Arariwa. 

Maria is 37 years old and lives with her partner and two children, ages 3 and 12. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as paper and ink. She dreams of owning a larger business and also would like to see her children become professionals.

Maria is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy printing supplies such as paper and ink.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto es un emprendedora que ya tiene varios ciclos que ha venido trabajando Fundación León 2000, en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con ganas de superación en su negocio de fritanga. Durante los créditos que se le han  brindado el emprendedor nos expresa que ha aumentado su variedad de comida  que le ofrece a sus clientes. Actualmente el emprendedor está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, verduras, bolsas, frutas, entre otros productos para la elaboración de la comida.
texts.en: Mario Alberto is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000 for several loan cycles.  During this time, he has shown himself to be a responsible person who has a desire to do well in his fried food business.  He tells us that the loans he has received have allowed him to increase the variety of food that he offers his customers.  He is currently requesting a loan to buy more products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, bags, fruit, etc. that he needs to prepare the food that he sells.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, bags, fruit and other products he needs to make the food that he sells

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.en:
Jose Alberto is originally from Quillabamba but currently lives in Cusco with his wife. Jose Alberto is 58 years old and has four children, including an economist and orthodontist. Two of them are studying engineering and tourism, respectively, at a university. 

Jose Alberto and his wife run a guesthouse in their home. Additionally, Jose Alberto works as a soccer coach, teaching children between the ages of 5 and 12 years old. He has been teaching fundamental soccer techniques for about 35 years. In fact, Jose Alberto spent one year playing for Cusco’s Cienciano soccer team.

Jose Alberto is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to his guesthouse. Specifically, he wants to fix two bathrooms that are now very old. The loan will be used to buy materials such as ceramic wall tiles. Jose Alberto would like to open a hotel in his hometown of Quillabamba in the future.

Jose Alberto is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy ceramic wall tiles to fix two bathrooms in his guesthouse.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
