Pedro es un  ciudadano que vive en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Dice que ha pensado en lo beneficioso  que sería para la comunidad  tener un proveedor de verduras y  legumbres  ya que los vecinos no tienen cerca negocios que los suplan  de estos productos de consumo diario. 

Además manifiesta don Pedro que con este negocio él saldría adelante y mejoraría la situación 
económica personal, ya que considera que el proyecto es prometedor, agrega que cuenta con el apoyo de la comunidad para realizar esta labor.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Pedro es un micro crédito de un millón cincuenta mil colones (1.050.000) para comprar y  vender verduras en las comunidades aledañas.

Don Pedro es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in a community called Osa, which is located in Caña Blancal, in Puntarenas province.  This community is known for being in a rural area which receives a lot of visitors to its beaches.  The main business activities in this area are tourism and agriculture.

Pedro says that he has thought about how beneficial it would be for his community to have a vegetable supplier because his neighbors do not have any businesses nearby that supply them with these essential products.  He also says that this business will help him to make progress in life and improve his personal financial situation as he believes it to be a promising project.  He adds that he has the support of his community in carrying out this business activity.

Pedro is currently requesting a micro loan for 1,050,000 colones so that he can buy vegetables to sell in neighboring communities.

Pedro is a member of the Caña Blancal community loan company, one of 110 organizations associated with EDESA in Costa Rica.  He hopes to use this loan to grow further on both a personal and financial level.  He also points out that, thanks to this type of organization who provide loans, he will be able to spend more time engaged in productive activities.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in his community

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EBENEZER est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Nadou Alice est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nadou Alice est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un certain Victor. Nadou Alice a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Nadou Alice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Nadou Alice vend depuis huit ans de la pâte fermentée sucrée ("Ablo") et des conserves de façon secondaire dans son quartier. Nadou Alice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Nadou Alice sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EBENEZER, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The EBENEZER group consists of three people, all living in the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that the group has requested financial assistance from Alidé, in order to increase its business activities.  The group representative, Nadou Alice, can be seen in the photo with her hand raised. Nadou Alice is 49 years old and she is married to Victor. She stopped studying at secondary school level. The couple has three children, all at school and in their care. Nadou Alice lives together with her husband and children and the couple share the various household expenses. As her contribution, Alice Nadou, has spent the last eight years selling "Ablo" (sweet fermented dough) and canned foods as a secondary activity  in her neighborhood. She stocks up at the Benin market.  In order to satisfy her clients and increase her sales and income, Nadou Alice is requesting, along with the other members of the Ebenezer group, a fourth loan from ALIDé.  All previous loans have been repaid satisfactorily.

loans.use: to buy corn, canned goods and veretable oil.
